description: Network traffic classification involves categorizing data packets based on their characteristics and behaviors. This is crucial for managing network resources, enhancing security, and optimizing performance in various environments.
you_have_this_if: You are experiencing difficulties in identifying types of network traffic.
Your current classification methods yield low accuracy.
You need real-time classification for software-defined networking (SDN).
You are looking for a solution that can adapt to evolving network patterns.
You want to implement a rule-based classification system.

approaches.best_for: when you need to classify network traffic in real-time for SDN environments and existing methods are inadequate.
approaches.key_tradeoff: GenClass offers high adaptability through genetic programming but may require more computational resources.

decision_matrix.best_when: You need a robust classification system that can evolve with network traffic patterns.

start_here: Start with GenClass if you require a flexible and accurate classification method that leverages genetic programming, especially in dynamic SDN environments.
